project.teaser: The MariTech Talent will develop a twin transition INTRApreneurship skills development programme, bringing maritime industry professionals and innovative enterprises with concrete digital solutions together in a two-way learning experience. The programme will provide:...
project.objective:
The MariTech Talent will develop a twin transition INTRApreneurship skills development programme, bringing maritime industry professionals and innovative enterprises with concrete digital solutions together in a two-way learning experience.
The programme will provide:
- Necessary twin skills for the maritime workforce - Support to deep tech solutions providers developing key technologies for unlocking the twin transition in the maritime industry
Thе MariTech Talent programme will apply a challenge-based INTRApreneurship model which will nurture learning by working on the most pressing needs identified by the ports and maritime companies themselves. Teams consisting of current workers and deep tech startups, scaleups and SMEs will work together to apply concrete solutions, undergoing the necessary training on the way. On the one hand the programme will secure the required skill set for the maritime workforce related to the green and digital transition. They will acquire operational knowledge in key digital domains enablers of the twin transition in the maritime industry such as machine learning and data analysis for predictive maintenance, energy management systems, system integration, automation, remote operation, cybersecurity and e-navigation through direct collaboration with deep tech solution providers. On the other, it will provide valuable insights and feedback on the relevance and effectiveness of the applied digital solutions. As a final result, maritime companies and ports will gain in-depth insights into the benefits digital solutions can bring to their operations, while at the same time their employees will become skilled and confident in their use.
project.title: MariTech Talent Programme
project.keywords: twin skills, green and digital transition, upskilling, maritime industry, deep tech talents

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - MariTech Talent (MariTech Talent Programme)
result.teaser: The project will develop a twin transition INTRApreneurship skills development programme, bringing maritime industry professionals and innovative enterprises with concrete digital solutions together in a two-way learning experience.The MariTech Talent program aims to provide a...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Task Force for regional maritime twin skills transition MoU
result.description: group of experts including consortia partners, industrial representatives, education and training providers, Pact for skills, Blueprint Alliances and EIT Deep Tech Talent representatives for providing expert feedback throughout the development of the program, its delivery, as well as in building its scaleup model. The work of the Task Force will be described in an MoU which will be signed, as part of the 2-day participatory workshop

result.title: Regional maritime industry twin skills needs analysis
South-East digital collaboration node
result.description: integrated environment that will bring together maritime stakeholders (maritime companies, workers, port authorities, shipbuilding and maritime technology companies), deep tech startups, scaleups and SMEs, and education and training providers from the targeted coastal regions, having as aim to essentially increase digital and green skills in the maritime sector. It will be the focal point for knowledge sharing and matchmaking, providing an online learning space which will enable stakeholders to benefit from the MariTech Programme

result.title: MariTech Talent Programme Framework
result.description: cutting-edge programme that complements the EU-wide offer while at the same time is able to respond to the specific company’s needs, through its intrapreneurship focus

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
